verses.roman:
jagannātha-sevaka yata rāja-pātra-gaṇa
yātrika loka, nīlācala-vāsī yata jana

synonyms: jagannātha-sevaka—the servants of Lord Jagannātha; yata—all; rāja-pātra-gaṇa—and the government officers; yātrika—pilgrim visitors; loka—people in general; nīlācala-vāsī—the residents of Jagannātha Purī; yata jana—as many people as there were.
translation: He sprinkled the minds of the servants of Lord Jagannātha, the government officers, the pilgrim visitors, the general populace and all the residents of Jagannātha Purī.
